price: Allah is your Lord Who created the heavens and earth in six Days and then rose over the Throne[4], governing all affairs[5]. None can intercede except by His permission[6]. Such is Allah your Lord, so worship Him. Will you not then take heed?
arabic: إِنَّ رَبَّكُمُ ٱللَّهُ ٱلَّذِي خَلَقَ ٱلسَّمَٰوَٰتِ وَٱلۡأَرۡضَ فِي سِتَّةِ أَيَّامٖ ثُمَّ ٱسۡتَوَىٰ عَلَى ٱلۡعَرۡشِۖ يُدَبِّرُ ٱلۡأَمۡرَۖ مَا مِن شَفِيعٍ إِلَّا مِنۢ بَعۡدِ إِذۡنِهِۦۚ ذَٰلِكُمُ ٱللَّهُ رَبُّكُمۡ فَٱعۡبُدُوهُۚ أَفَلَا تَذَكَّرُونَ
footnotes:
[4] See footnote 7:54.
 [5] This is a manifest sign of Allah’s omnipotence, and thus He alone is worthy of worship.
 [6] He is not like any sovereign whose inner circle of close aides and relatives dare to intercede, relying on his need for them.

version.title: English Translation - Rowwad Translation Center
version.description: Translation of the Quran meanings into Englsih by Rowwad Translation Center in cooperation with Islamhouse.com

meta.transliteration: inna rabbakumu al-lahu alladhī khalaqa al-samāwāti wal-arḍa fī sittati ayyāmin thumma is'tawā ʿalā al-ʿarshi yudabbiru al-amra mā min shafīʿin illā min baʿdi idh'nihi dhālikumu al-lahu rabbukum fa-uʿ'budūhu afalā tadhakkarūna
